page.title: 04Pebsham Estate & Surrounds
page.content: An effort is being made to keep Bexhill separated from Hastings & St. Leonard's by preserving a green belt from Glyne Gap northwards.This is only one field's width at its south end,and building has encroached upon former farmland in recent years.Pebsham Farm is now closely overlooked by new estates on its east side,and building continues presently.Where sheep and some horses now graze and oil seed rape blooms in nearby fields the network of residential roads threatens to cover more agricultural land.Around Combe Haven there is no development as it is so liable to flooding.Buses now serve some of Pebsham,making it easier for residents to commute to and from work.A suburb of Bexhill,the built-up part of Pebsham is now about one tenth of the total area of the town.There are mainly young people in Pebsham.
